definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: The rise of global history has aroused widespread attention in the history profession around the world.
sentences.chinese: 全球史的勃興已經引起國際史壇的廣泛矚目。

sentences.english: III. Globalization and the plight and revival of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 全球化與社會主義的困境和勃興。

sentences.english: To the Han and Tang, doubt about history detection of forgeries of the wind is flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 到了漢唐，疑古辨僞之風更是勃興。

sentences.english: The boom’s third driving force is the rapid globalisation of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 這一輪勃興的第三大驅動力就是快速的工業全球化。

sentences.english: The development of travels literary works is closely related with the process of the humanized natural .
sentences.chinese: 遊觀文學的勃興與自然的“人性化”過程緊密相聯。
